   How Quantum Computers Work
 
Quantum computers use the power of atoms to perform memory and processing tasks. Scientists have already built basic quantum computers that can perform certain calculations, but a practical quantum computer is still years away. Learn what a quantum computer is and just what it'll be used for in the next era of computing.
 Also at HowStuffWorks
 

Graphics Cards Make Your Computer Graphics Pop - Serious gamers know that a cutting-edge graphics card can
really beef up your performance and sharpen your games' visual experience.
Consumer Guide offers this purchase guide to walk you through the basics of
graphics cards and suggests some options for users of every level.
 

How do I add another USB device to my computer if I am out
of USB ports? - Most computers that you buy today come with only one or two
USB sockets. With so many USB devices on the market today, it's easy to run out
of sockets for them unless you have a USB hub. Find out what you need to know
when choosing a powered or unpowered USB hub for your devices.
 

How Bluetooth Works - What do you do when you need your computer to
"talk" to your cell phone? Bluetooth allows any sort of electronic
equipment to connect without wires, cables or any direct action from you. Learn
how Bluetooth works.
   
This Week's Video 


How to Install Dual Monitors - Have you ever wanted to have more screen space when using
your computer? Perhaps you'd like to be able to see two full-sized applications
at the same time. This HowStuffWorks video shows you how to install dual
monitors on your computer system.
